Topic.Title: "What difference, at this point, does it make?"

Message.Msg: It's simple. A black man didn't start the war in Iraq. You only have to watch what these nutjobs post for 2-3 days to realize that they are all cryptoracists (who aren't very good at the "crypto" part) sucking on a city, county, state, or federal sugar tit retirement. None of them are intelligent enough to have survived in the private sector for more than fifteen minutes and now they are biting the hand that feeds them, has always fed them, because they are terrified that someone coming up beneath them might in some way deprive them of some portion of their "benefits"... if you want to see the Depends awhirl, have empty tins of Ensure thrown at your head and be in danger of being run down by a "hoveround" (thanks jon for that; at 42 y/o, I had never heard of a "hoeveround" but getting one sounds like a goal for you) call them "entitlements". That's always fun on Thu night when they've just gotten back from dominoes and what little is left of their testosterone is boiling from absorbing yet another loss in a life that is a seemingly endless string of defeats.

Message.Title: What's with this stock?
Message.Msg: It seems like it never goes up no matter how well the markets are doing that day. It had a nice run recently but looks to be stuck again. T has a history of reaching a certain level and languishing for years. $35-$36 may be the new normal for this stock for a long time. Another nasty earnings report and that "normal" could slide a few dollars lower. Very disheartening for longs that got in above $35.

Topic.Title: Finally we find out "What difference...does it make?"

Message.Msg: The woman applying for a job in a Florida lemon grove seemed to be far too qualified for the job. She had a liberal arts degree from the University of Michigan and had worked as a social worker and school teacher. The foreman frowned and said, "I have to ask you, have you had any actual experience in picking lemons?" "Well, as a matter of fact, I have! I've been divorced three times, owned 2 Chryslers and voted for Obama."

Topic.Title: Top IRS Official Didn't Reveal Tea Party Targeting

Message.Msg: Benghazi, according to Pickering, was the fault of top-level members of the SS's staff. The IRS, at least initially, was independent actions by some low lever staffers. The Justice Department, with Fast and Furious and the not so subtle spying on the AP but that the President didn't know about any of these actions. It is appearing more and more that there is no one in charge in this administration. Staffs running off breaking laws, getting people killed, spying on the media and no one in power knew any of this was going on? Maybe if he was trying to LEAD his administration and this country instead of continuing to campaign for an election he won, he might have a clue what is going on. This LEADER has a supreme lack of leadership and understanding of what that term means. Holder and the head of the IRS need to resign or be fired. Little Timmy and Hillary skipped town just in time it appears.

Topic.Title: Tea party, right wing extreme, GOP congress, etc's defintion of proof

Message.Msg: The leader is responsible for the actions of his staff. He handpicked his cabinet; they picked lower level staff members. It is his responsibility to pick competent, honest people with the personal integrity to perform within the rules of law, decency, and common sense. He has failed time after time to have done so. He is a poor leader. He has not real leadership skill beyond public speaking and when the tele-prompter goes down he doesn't really excel at that. All the things that we didn’t know about him when he first got elected are beginning to show their true colors and his lack of leadership will eventually ruin this term and his legacy. As his favorite preacher says, the chickens are coming home to roost.

Topic.Title: Start a charity at your home

Message.Msg: I'd say they apply little effort to either. It requires hiring investigators which requires an allocation of funds which isn't something certain people are willing to do. It is very hard to get people to pay attention to this because not catching people for fraud is an intangible cost. Fraud prevented (as opposed to caught) due to enforcement is theoretical and difficult to measure at best. When it comes to tax fraud, some people are opposed to preventing it. The Heritage Foundation has been known to list increased revenues due to fraud enforcement as a tax increase, something that should be opposed by the Norquist group.

Topic.Title: Finally we find out "What difference...does it make?"

Message.Msg: Well I'm not the only one: The Washington Post: Posted by Glenn Kessler at 06:00 AM ET, 05/14/2013 Fact Check: Obama’s claim he called Benghazi an ‘act of terrorism’ Statement is given a Four Pinocchios rating which is defines the statement as a Whopper You can easily go to their site for the full evaluation, assuming you care to check it.

Topic.Title: Finally we find out "What difference...does it make?"

Message.Msg: 'Notably, during a debate with Republican nominee Mitt Romney, President Obama said that he immediately told the American people that the killing of the U.S. ambassador and three other Americans in Libya “was an act of terror.” But now he says he called it “an act of terrorism.” Some readers may object to this continuing focus on words, but presidential aides spend a lot of time on words. Words have consequences. Is there a difference between “act of terror” and “act of terrorism”?' Again, you have got to be kidding me. The level of parsing you are doing here, in all of these various things, is nonsensical. The President and Susan Rice were clearly very careful not to conclude that this was an act of terrorism or that Al-Queada was involved prematurely. As they should be. (I seem to remember that you wanted us to invade Syria last week). But they also clearly stated that extremist elements were involved and they were waiting before making any final decisions. What on earth is wrong with that? Absolutely nothing is wrong with that. In fact, it is what most Americans hope their government will do. It is what the Obama administration has always done. It is clear that your only complaint is that he did this just prior to an election and you think that this event, if portrayed as a terrorist act immediately, would have somehow swayed the election. I hope you keep thinking that because it is outlandish and wrong. I hope you keep barking up this tree because it will ensure that you people never hold a major national office again. You lost the election because states which were previously "purple" are now consistently "blue" in Senate and Electoral votes, because Romney was a poor candidate, and because your policies appeal to a dying constituency of mostly elderly, white, rural and affluent people--four groups which are shrinking in this country. So either adjust or get over it. I don't really care.

Message.Title: HHS branch of Obama SS shakes down insurance companies
Message.Msg: Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius is shaking down companies her agency might regulate, to help sign up uninsured Americans for ObamaCare. Sebelius in recent weeks has put the strong arm various charitable foundations, businesses executives, churches and doctors to donate money to nonprofit organizations, such as Enroll America, that are helping to implement President Obama's health care overhaul.

Message.Title: And this just in...
Message.Msg: ...Simpson Granted 1 Hand Free During Vegas Hearing LAS VEGAS (routers) O.J. Simpson won a small victory on Tuesday when he returned to court for Day 2 of his attempt to win a new trial in his robbery case: A judge said he could have one hand unshackled to drink water and take notes. Simpson managed a smile and a waist-high wave with his shackled hand as he entered the courtroom and found friends and family members in the audience. With his free hand, he then donned a glove, struggling to get it on, then, in deference to either Johnnie Cochran or Michael Jackson, he moon-walked across the front of the courtroom, before stabbing the court reporter and the bailiff and escaping in a waiting Ford Bronco, driven by Al Cowlings, who has been unemployed since June of 1994. They were last seen at a Jack-in-the-Box restaurant being confronted by a group of hooded vigilantes, with O.J. pleading that he just wanted his stuff back. Film at eleven.

Message.Title: DOJ branch of Obama SS infiltrates AP
Message.Msg: The Associated Press announced Monday that the DOJ stole two months of telephone records of reporters and editors without the news organization's knowledge. The records stolen by the department listed outgoing calls for the work and personal phone numbers of individual reporters, for general AP office numbers in New York, Washington and Hartford, Conn., and for the main number for the AP in the House of Representatives press gallery, according to attorneys for the AP.
